text: Hi, my name is Jose and I would like to ask a question, how can I add a button inside a CRM card? My idea is to call another page on that button (I don't know how to do it either). I appreciate all the help you can give me
Hi does anyone know how to refresh the right panel of HubSpot without reloading the page using react extension ui?

Hi there again Carter.

Thank you so much for your help.
If it's okay, I'd like to pick your brain once more.


I got things working and have an app running as per the guide from here.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-quickstart>

When I say working, I mean was able to upload the code and can see it in the CRM contacts.

On the other hand there is seems to be a problem with the local dev server running. I'm on a mac pro with M3 and with the Webstorm IDE.

I get the error.

```Missing required arguments to initialize Local Dev```

Arh... I took a wild guess. The missing argument is the portal.name from the HubSpot.config.yml.

Perhaps that might be mentioned in the doc linked above. :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi there.

I'm wondering if there is a place where I can set CSP settings to allow contact to outside services, in this case for running a websocket. You can see in my console the following error.

`because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "connect-src none".`

In places like Salesforce, Zendesk and Freshdesk I can set allowed domains, and I'm wondering if you have something similar please.
honestly it's been such a long time since I setup the CLI but I remember running hs init, and I don't know if I also ran hs auth
These react cards run in a sandbox so no network requests are allowed

You could use a button: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components#button>

or a CRM Data button:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components#action-button>

The regular button would probably be the easiest
Thank you. Do you think there will be a possibility in the future for developers to be able to set allowed domains?
I doubt it, these extensions are based on shopify's react-ui library (now called react-dom) and it kinda goes against the core principles
